oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Integrated Resource Management: Opportunities for the Veterinary Practitioner
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Wohlgemuth, Kurt
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Integrated Resource Management
IRM
Technical experts
Financial experts
Extension personnel
Rancher
Research data
Economic consideration
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Integrated Resource Management (IRM) has been defined as "a management system which integrates people and technology to manage resources in order to obtain a projected level of profits in a given livestock enterprise (or business)." (1)Basic elements of IRM are:a. People: Rancher, ManagerTechnical experts (veterinarian, nutritionist, engineer, etc ... )Financial expertsExtension personnelb. Technology base: Research datac. Economic consideration: Profit vs loss
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1989; 79-80
